greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: product of the Mobius matrix A054525 by the diagonal matrix diag(A000203(n)).
comment: Left column = mu(n), A008683; right border = sigma(n), A000203; row sums = n.
The definition of Mobius transform is extended to matrices here in the sense of "left multiplication by the Mobius matrix A054525". - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 02 2007
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: A000203T := proc(n,k) if n = k then numtheory[sigma](n) ; else 0 ; fi ; end: A054525 := proc(n,k) if n < 1 or k > n or n mod k <> 0 then 0; else numtheory[mobius](n/k) ; fi ; end: A127569 := proc(n,k) add(A054525(n,i)*A000203T(i,k),i=1..n) ; end: for n from 1 to 15 do for k from 1 to n do printf("%a, ",A127569(n,k)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 02 2007
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 19 2007
